short_summary: purchase of 1 benchtop x-ray system for CNRC (NRC), including training and support
full_summary:
Government Notice of Invitation to Tender
Reference Number: 23-58025 cb-8385-1774454

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) invites qualified contractors to participate in a Request for Proposal (RFP) and submit their bid for the supply and delivery of one (1) Benchtop X-ray Micro Computed Tomography (Micro CT) system as per the Statement of Requirement in Annex "A".

**Bidder Information**

- Solicitation Number: 23-58025
- Solicitation Date: August 23, 2023
- Closing Date and Time: September 6, 2023, 14:00 EDT (Server Time)
- Amendment Number: 1

**Contract Details**

- Contracting Entity Name: National Research Council Canada
- Contracting Entity Address: 1200 Montreal Road, Ottawa, ON K1A 0R6, Canada
- Contracting Authority: Katie Homuth, Senior Contracting Officer
- Contact Information: Katie.Homuth@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca, (343) 549-4539

**Tender Requirements**

- The Bidder must submit an electronic Technical Proposal and one electronic Financial Proposal in separate attachments as per the Bid Preparation Instructions.
- The Technical Proposal must be marked "Technical Proposal" and the Financial Proposal must be marked "Financial Proposal".
- The Bidder's name, the bid solicitation reference number, and bid solicitation closing date and time must be clearly visible.
- The Bidder must provide a comprehensive and detailed bid, including all requested pricing details, that will permit a complete evaluation in accordance with the criteria set out in the Bid Solicitation.

**Evaluation Criteria**

The evaluation team will assess the bids based on the Mandatory Technical Criteria (MTCs) listed in Annex "C". The MTCs include but are not limited to:

- The Micro CT must have a minimum energy of X-ray source of at least 20 kV to provide more contrast of low-density materials.
- The Micro CT must come with a software suite that allows for system control and data acquisition, including activating/deactivating the X-ray source, accessing the specimen chamber via live camera, controlling the sample stage rotation and position, and adjusting the acquisition parameters.
- The Micro CT must come with a software suite that must allow for volumetric reconstruction and 2D/ 3D quantitative analysis, including volume reconstruction based on CPU and GPU acceleration, 3D and 2D morphometric analysis, and exporting reconstructed models
